article.headline: Boston University 74, Manhattan 65
article.story: NEW YORK (AP) -- Freshman guard Corey Lowe scored 28 points, including a school-record-matching seven 3-pointers, to help Boston University defeat Manhattan 74-65 Saturday night. Tyler Morris added 15 points and Ibrahim Konate, Scott Brittain and Omari Peterkin each scored eight for the visiting Terriers (2-3). Darryl Crawford had 17 points and Devon Austin 13 for the Jaspers (2-3). Christian Jackson and Arturo Dubois added 12 points apiece. Lowe was 7-of-13 on 3-pointers, and BU was 10-of-19 overall from behind the arc. Manhattan was 3-of-17 from 3-point range. Lowe's seven 3-pointers tied the BU single-game mark posted by Matt Turner twice during the 2000-01 season. Manhattan led by as much as 23-14 early, but Lowe scored 12 points as the Terriers took a 37-33 lead at the half. The game was last tied at 46-46 with 13:46 left to play. Morris followed with a 3-pointer to put the Terriers on top 49-46 and give them a lead they never relinquished.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
